column4: hi can someone help me? ever since i removed ubuntu-desktop meta-package, apt-get wants to remove a bunch of critical packages, including glibc!...i can't use apt-get without it automatically removing packages needed for linux to work
this didnt happen with dapper, please help
does anyone know how to fix my apt-get?
You may be able to massage the package selections list. try dpkg --get-selections > selections
then edit the file selections, look for anything that has 2nd column not "install"
but be careful, make sure you use valid values.
and make a backup of that "selections" file before you edit it. You can always roll back by reading in the old file.
what do i do if there is deinstall in the 2nd column for a package?
That's the one that's effing up your apt. It thinks that you want to uninstall. Change it to "install" (or whatever the correct value is, you'll see it in there a hundred times)
i see 4 packages that are deinstall
Change them to install. The run the "dpkg --set-selections < selections"
it still says the following packages were automatically installed and are no longer required: and lists every package
I'll be back in about 10 minutes. Have to swap hardware back.
ok it lists those 4 i changed
